item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 25, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Plwm – An X11 window manager written in Prolog (107 points | 16 comments)
2. Ask HN: What are you working on? (May 2025) (57 points | 165 comments)
3. Lottie is an open format for animated vector graphics (219 points | 94 comments)
4. Path to a free self-taught education in Computer Science (114 points | 60 comments)
5. Writing your own CUPS printer driver in 100 lines of Python (2018) (115 points | 13 comments)
6. Lisping at JPL (2002) (85 points | 19 comments)

9. Design Pressure: The Invisible Hand That Shapes Your Code (112 points | 29 comments)
10. Writing a Self-Mutating x86_64 C Program (2013) (59 points | 19 comments)
11. Koog, a Kotlin-based framework to build and run Al agents in idiomatic Kotlin (24 points | discuss)
12. Show HN: DaedalOS – Desktop Environment in the Browser (88 points | 18 comments)
13. Denmark to raise retirement age to 70 (209 points | 498 comments)
14. CAPTCHAs are over (in ticketing) (83 points | 99 comments)

17. Martin (YC S23) Is Hiring Founding AI/Product Engineers to Build a Better Siri ( | hide)
18. Is TfL losing the battle against heat on the Victoria line? (62 points | 91 comments)
19. 'Strange metals' point to a whole new way to understand electricity (87 points | 26 comments)
20. Tariffs in American History (62 points | 94 comments)
21. Can a corporation be pardoned? (40 points | 59 comments)
22. Show HN: SVG Animation Software (153 points | 68 comments)
23. On File Formats (103 points | 67 comments)
24. Dependency injection frameworks add confusion (88 points | 103 comments)
25. Now you can watch the Internet Archive preserve documents in real time (102 points | 9 comments)
26. Programming on 34 Keys (2022) (51 points | 68 comments)
27. Show HN: AI Baby Monitor – local Video-LLM that beeps when safety rules break (68 points | 49 comments)
28. Show HN: Wall Go – browser remake of a Devil's Plan 2 mini-game (25 points | 8 comments)
29. The Newark airport crisis (101 points | 76 comments)
30. Claude Opus 4 turns to blackmail when engineers try to take it offline (76 points | 55 comments)
